course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Research Methods in Psychological Science
course.description: This course introduces students to the basic research principles in psychological science. It evaluates various research designs and statistical analyses, and discusses relevant ethical issues encountered in studying human behaviors. Priority will be given to students of the Psychological and Behavioural Science Minor programs.

reviews.author: 可唔可以快d畢業
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction: What is science?
2. Where to start? The beginning of the research journey
3. Workshop: How to conduct literature search?
4. Psychological Measurement
5. Research ethics: Is the study ethical?
6. Qualitative methods
7. Survey
8. Experimental design
9. Factorial design
10. Basic statistics: Statistical inference and statistical relationships
11. Workshop: Statistics with R

syllabus前段教research嘅基本野，同1960/1980 overlap，幾輕鬆。

中段開始教你點樣設計一個research，內容唔難，問題係gp project要自己design一個research，好難，越做落去去越發現更加多漏洞，畢竟作為ug真係冇咩機會自己做research，所以好嘅groupmate好重要，每個人都要幫手睇個research有冇地方唔啱或者夠唔夠justifiable。

後段少少stat野，要用r studio。大家放心，workshop唔會知佢教緊乜，因為根本唔夠時間逐樣解釋，youtube幫到你。

整體唔難，最麻煩係gp project，算係信息量比較少嘅一個course。

依家Online teaching，仲要7個人一組，要有心理準備俾人freeride，我地組就係咁，good luck。
reviews.comment_teaching: 講野好清楚，節奏唔會好快好易跟。基本上上堂就係跟住ppt讀再加elaboration。有聽過其他人話唔中意佢淨係讀ppt，但係其實佢好responsive，上堂有咩問題佢都會答曬，間唔中又有啲poll同我地互動下，好有心教。

reviews.author: Lyh
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite simple so it may be a little boring, especially if you studied Psychology in IB/AP/A levels. Even if you have no background in psychology, you can understand the content quite easily.

Topics:
1. Introduction: What is science?
2. Beginning of research Journey
3. Workshop: How to conduct literature search?
4. Psychological Measurement
5. Research ethics: Is the study ethical?
6. Qualitative methods
7. Survey
8. Experimental design
9. Factorial design
10. Quasi-experimental designs
11. Basic statistics: Statistical inference and statistical relationships
12. Workshop: Statistics with R
13. Recent methodological advances
14. Current issues in psychology research
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think Professor Lai is very very nice! She tries to make the course interesting and easy to understand even though content is quite simple and boring. She tries to makes class more interactive but it was 9am class so everyone had our cameras off on zoom and were muted (felt bad for her).

She is very willing to answer questions and respond to emails relatively fast.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 individual assignments (25%)
Group project (30%)
Peer Review Paper (25%)
Quiz (20%)

Assignment 1 (5/5, mean: 4)
Assignment 2 (9/10, mean: 8.2)
Assignment 3 (8.5/10, mean: 7.5)
Group Project proposal (5/5, mean: 5)
Group Project (23/25, mean: 20.7)
Peer Review Paper (23/25, mean: 22.2)
Quiz (11.67/20, mean: 11.5)

Final Grade: A-

Overall, I still don’t really understand what the TA/ the professor’s criteria are. They don’t really provide a rubric, so make sure to ask what she’s looking for before you work on your group project/assignments/paper.  

The quiz (basically a final) was unexpectedly a little tricky, but mainly due to time pressure and misreading the question. There were many parts to each questions, so make sure you answer all the sub-questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
All assignments have word limits and she spreads out the deadlines pretty well.

The individual assignments are fairly easy, which can be completed within an hour.

As long as you find good group mates and split work accordingly, you will be alright. Make sure to ask the professor if your group is heading towards the right direction as you are designing your experiment.

Peer review paper is not too difficult too since there’s word limit to it, but I suggest you to take notes of other group’s presentation so you don’t have to waste time rewatching their presentation.

reviews.author: therock
reviews.title: Friendly Prof, Boring Class
reviews.comment_content: Content was suuuuper boring-- definitely the hardest to pay attention to from all the psych classes I've taken. It's not too difficult if you've done any other psych class, since they normally cover a bit of research methods anyways, but here you just go into a lot of detail.
reviews.comment_teaching: Beatrice is a really nice and friendly prof, but because she speaks pretty slow I would just rewatch the lectures on 2x speed. She does her best to make content interesting, so props for that.
reviews.comment_grading: Honestly, I was expecting C/D and got B-, so I'd say grading is pretty good! I got 0 on an assignment because I submitted the wrong file, and had slightly above or below the mean on everything else.
reviews.comment_workload: Really light workload as there's no quiz/midterm/final, but you must put a bit of time into the group project. Still, from all my group projects at UST, this was one of the least time consuming one. The assignments are very easy and don't take much time.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.title: 出乎意料地靚Grade
reviews.comment_content:
PBS minor compulsory course. Basically, a course teaches you how to do researches and introduces some basic research methods in the psychological field. If you have studied relevant research methods courses from other majors, you will probably find it a bit similar and boring to hear the same stuff for another time.

This course introduces students to the basic research principles in psychological science. It evaluates various research designs and statistical analyses and discusses relevant ethical issues encountered in studying human behaviors.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Beatrice undoubtedly looks very young. You cannot imagine she already has a son. I would say her teaching style is quite straight forward. She follows the ppt slide flow and then elaborates on every single point with some examples given. However, the examples are not in the ppt which make us a bit difficult to understand as we need to interpret the meanings behind by ourselves.

She is not that kind of funny professor but at least she is a local professor so you can fully understand her lecture very well. She is very nice and patient when it comes to answering our questions. I think most of us struggle in understanding the concepts as some contents are quite tricky and advanced. We keep asking questions during break time and she is so patient to read it one by one and answer them. If you have any problems, don't hesitate to find her.
reviews.comment_grading:
Totally out of my expectations. It is way much better than I expected before, especially after hearing from other friends, who had taken her 1960 and 1980 classes before.

多謝佩儀姐無爛我grade
reviews.comment_workload:
Suppose 無左個quiz workload 應該會細左，因為唔使真正明曬全部research methods，慳左好多溫書時間，但取而代之係多左一份極及麻煩的individual assignment。雖然每一份assignment 都限字數, e.g. 200 words, 400 words，但因為你唔會知道究竟TA個評分準則係咩，所以做每一份都做得好辛苦，加上從來不會講返個正確答案係咩，即使TA會寫返comment，但點派分永遠係個迷。

Project 幾大workload，要propose一個 research study, formulate a research hypothesis(es) and to propose a research design to test your hypothesis(es). 不過不用live presentation，embed recording file 落個ppt slides 就可以。

Peer Review Paper 純粹comment其他組既proejct，講下有咩問題同給建議解決問題。不過寫得越多有機會扣分扣得越多，因為會有更多機會給beatrice捉到錯處，似乎係根據beatrice寫左幾多個comment，就扣幾多分。因為beatrice寫左4個comment，所以我就被扣左4分。

She is always nice and energetic, which motivates students for her 9am lecture. She explains the content very clearly and is always willing to answer any questions raised by the students. Easy to follow!
She also gives quite a lot of examples in lessons to further explain the concepts, which helps when you revise for the final quiz.

reviews.comment_workload:
There are 3 individual assignments, which are all very short in length as she set word limits for the assignments.

There is also a group project and Q&A session where students from other groups may ask you questions on your work. Just find some good group mates and collaborate well, then you should be fine with the project. Also, would be great to attend the consulting session with Prof, she will give you useful suggestions and tell you whether you are on the right track.

You also need to submit a peer-review paper which you need to mention about the performance of other groups based on their group projects, attending the Q&A session and take notes on other's presentations wold help.
